Description: Bone doll's head; carved and painted on the upper portion to represent the eyes, nose and fringe of hair; the lower portion is plain.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Siraf, Site: D Area: - Context: 316
Curator's comments: This would originally have been inserted into the cloth body of a composite doll.

On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314, esp. 299, 311.
